entries.meaning: (UK, New Zealand, Australia) A normally deep-red-coloured root vegetable usually cooked or pickled before eating; Synonym of beet.
(usually uncountable) The edible part of the root of a beet plant, raw or prepared.

verbs.description: beetroot (third-person singular simple present beetroots, present participle beetrooting, simple past and past participle beetrooted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, informal) To turn a bright red or purple colour.
